page.title: 19 LOCAL ISSUES - WEST ROW
page.content: PROBLEMS CONNECTED WITH PLANNING AND HOUSING ARE THE USUAL ISSUES WHICH LOCAL COUNCILLORS HAVE TO TACKLE ON BEHALF OF THE PEOPLE THEY REPRESENT. IN PARTICULAR, NEW HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS ARE VIEWED WITH A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF CONCERN, LEST THEY SPOIL THE QUIET ATMOSPHERE OF THE VILLAGE. IN THE PAST, VILLAGERS HAVE CAMPAIGNED FOR A 30m.p.h. SPEED LIMIT, A CENTRAL WHITE LINE ON THE ROAD TO MILDENHALL, AND THE RESHAPING OF A DANGEROUS ROAD JUNCTION. ALL HAVE BEEN SUCCESSFUL. MANY LOCAL FARMERS VIEW WITH CONCERN DETERIORATING ROAD SURFACES, ESPECIALLY IN THE FENS, WHILE IN THE VILLAGE ITSELF SOME PEOPLE, NOTABLY THE ELDERLY, REGRET THE ALMOST COMPLETE LACK OF PAVEMENTS BORDERING THE ROADS.
